result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan M. Poblitz

records.addlTxt:
10:39 a.m. Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in court, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica Phelps in court for Alan M. Poblitz. 
Cases heard today are 20CF464, 21CF60, 21CF107, 21CF172, 21CM87 and 22CF90.

ADA Jambois calls the cases and states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
20CF464:
Count 1 - No contest 

21CF60:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 

21CF107:
Count 1- Dismissed and Read In 

21CF172:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Dismissed and Read In 

21CM87:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 

22CF90:
Count 1 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 3 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 4 - Dismissed and Read In 
Count 5 - Dismissed and Read In 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 in 20CF464:  Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine (>3-10g) 961.41(1)(e)2 as a repeater 939.62(1)(b).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
**Dismissed and Read In:
21CF60:  Count 1-3
21CF107:  Count 1
21CF172:  Count 1-5
21CM87:  Count 1 & 2
22CF90:  Count 1-5

ADA Jambois makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Phelps makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court questions credit and restitution - parties respond.
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
20CF464-
Count 1:  
Determinate Prison Sentence of 6 years -
Initial Confinement:  3 Years
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
53 days of pretrial incarceration credit
Extended Supervision:  3 Years
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions 
Participate in any treatment, counseling and assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide DNA Sample, if not already done  
Bond monies to be applied and the remaining balance returned to the poster


20 days to appeal
Order to Produce /s/ PB 07/27/22
Proposed Order to Produce
Notice of Assignment of Judge to Zell - moved, left no address
Judge Patricia Baker assigned

for Aug 9, 2022 hearing
Order to Produce filed by the State (sent to Br 1 Judge on 06/08/22 sp)
Plea/Sentencing set for 08/09/22 - per post office mail received under General Delivery (defendant has not provided updated address)
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 05/09/22 - moved, left no address
matter scheduled for plea/sent 8/9/22 at 10:30
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

filed by Atty Jessica Phelps 
*case # incorrect on document*

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:56 PM Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in court.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica Phelps in court for Alan M. Poblitz. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Adjourned Pretrial Conference (doesnt show online) scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alan M. Poblitz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jessica Phelps appeared in court for Alan M. Poblitz. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Phelps asks to address bond today. He has posted bonds or have signature bonds on his other open files.  Asks to lower to a $300 cash bond.  He is on a probation hold due to expire on 3/18.
Atty Mutchler makes bond arguments to the court in opposition to the modification of bond. 

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied for the reasons stated on the record.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Phelps.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Jessica Phelps appointed
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

02:56 PM Defendant Alan M. Poblitz appeared by video. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant states he has Atty Jessica Phelps but has not been able to get ahold of her.  He did have a public defender come to see him and he did qualify.  That was on the last time he was in court, possibly the 4th. Defendant asks to adjourn to allow him to get an attorney.  
Court informs the defendant to call the public defender. 
Court will adjourn for 2 weeks. 

Defendant is being held only on thi s case.  Asks to reduce bond. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant states he is on a probation hold.  Asks for a lower cash bond to $250 because he can come up with that. 
Atty Mutchler indicates he has 7 open cases among counties with multiple non appearance date. 

BY THE COURT:
Court does not reduce the bond at this time.  
Court informs the defendant to speak to his attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription, and only as prescribed.
Do not associate with other who consume controlled substances illegally.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant by phone.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of THC (2nd), Bail Jumping (Multiple), Resisting an Officer, and Misappopriating Identifying Info to Avoid Penalty. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Public defender will continue to represent the defendant.
Court informs the defendant of the upcoming appearance.
Defendant states he understands.

State requests a $750 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule makes bond arguments. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for: 02-21-2022 @ 2 p.m. in Branch 1.
